qas.question: When did a British expedition to Tibet invade the country?
With whom were the British hopeing to negotiate?
How many Tibetan troops died at the Massacre of Chumik Shenko?
How many British troops died at the Massacre of Chumik Shenko?
Who imposed the Treaty of Lhasa?
Who did the 12th Dalai Lama negotiate with?

context: In <a0_0>1904<a0_0/>, <b5_0>a <b6_0>British<b6_0/> expedition<b5_0/> to Tibet, spurred in part by a fear that Russia was extending its power into Tibet as part of The Great Game, invaded the country, hoping that negotiations with the <a1_0>13th Dalai Lama<a1_0/> would be more effective than with Chinese representatives. When the British-led invasion reached Tibet on December 12, 1903, an armed confrontation with the ethnic Tibetans resulted in <b7_0><b8_0><b9_0>the Massacre of Chumik Shenko<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/>, which resulted in <a2_0>600<a2_0/> fatalities amongst the Tibetan forces, compared to only <a3_0>12<a3_0/> on the British side. Afterwards, in 1904 <a4_0>Francis Younghusband<a4_0/> imposed a treaty known as the Treaty of Lhasa, which was subsequently repudiated and was succeeded by a 1906 treaty signed between Britain and China.
